chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant William A Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: 13CF1372

miscConds.notes:
Remaining BAIL APPLIED OF $232.00. Balance of Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

No violent contact with Diane H.
No contact with any other victims or witnesses.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Restitution of $487.15 to Wisconsin Mutual Insurance Co.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William A Hudson in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1 and 2. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  - consecutive to 13CF1372  Stayed for 4 years Probation - concurrent to 13CF1372
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply any remaining bail from 13CF1372
- Restitution of $487.15 to Wisconsin Mutual Insurance
- DNA Surcharge is waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No violent contact with Diane H.. No contact with any other victims or witnesses. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 6 months jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 1  and 13CF1372 Stayed for 4 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1 and 13CF1372
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge is waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No violent contact with Diane H.. No contact with any other victims or witnesses. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
